meanings.definition: To buy or acquire in advance.
meanings.sent1: She prepurchases her concert tickets to ensure she gets good seats.
meanings.sent2: He always prepurchases his favorite video games to avoid missing out on the release day.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prepurchases nuts for the winter, showing great foresight.
meanings.sent4: The wise investor prepurchases stocks when the prices are low.
meanings.sent5: Planning ahead, she prepurchases all her holiday gifts to avoid last-minute stress.

meanings.definition: The act of buying or acquiring in advance.
meanings.sent1: His prepurchases of limited edition sneakers have become a hobby.
meanings.sent2: The company's prepurchases of raw materials helped them avoid supply chain issues.
meanings.sent3: The prepurchases of movie tickets for the whole year made him feel like a VIP.
meanings.sent4: Her prepurchases of books made her home library grow steadily.
meanings.sent5: The prepurchases of concert tickets made the event sold out in record time.
